titles.title: Gray Zone Defense Assessment Act
Gray Zone Defense Assessment Act
To assess the capacity of the United States to effectively marshal disparate elements of national power to counter adversary political warfare campaigns, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

bill.summary:
Gray Zone Defense Assessment Act
This bill directs the President and Department of State to report to Congress on U.S. capabilities to respond to gray zone campaigns. Gray zone campaigns are coercive activities a nation uses to achieve its objectives, not including diplomacy or armed conflict.
